attributes.action: Stop WiFi enabled devices being automatically enrolled into public wifi programs
attributes.additional_details: Many companies are exploring the idea of utilising wifi enabled devices within our homes, to create public wifi networks. This utilises an internet connection that we pay for, decreasing our home network's security and potentially network performance and is all currently possible without our permission. This can be enabled via a remote software update and could go ahead without the owner of the device knowing.
attributes.background: I would like the government to prohibit the use of the opt-out system when companies roll out public wifi programs which utilise wifi-enabled devices within our homes.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a matter for Ofcom, who regulate internet providers.

You can find information about contacting Ofcom here: https://www.ofcom.org.uk/home
